The mental part of softball is so important. Even though many of the best players celebrate only three out of 10 victories, failing more than you succeed is something that is very hard to accept. For the majority of my softball career I have struggled with this, but Cal State Fullerton gave me a new lens.
Titan Softball recently had the opportunity to work with a sports psychologist, and Iâve learned skills to help me on and off the field. Having a focal point like my bat keeps me grounded whenever I am stressed or doing too much. When Iâm not on the field, I look at the sky or the ceiling.






As a student and an athlete, Iâve also learned to have a plan. For softball, putting in the extra practice before a weekend game is vital to feeling confident for the opponent I am going to face. With school, mapping out all of my assignments helps me feel prepared to do my best.
Being on the Titan Softball team is a great honor for me. Iâm the first one in my family to get a scholarship to play a sport at a Division 1 university. After I graduate, I hope to further my career in softball, become a coach and continue to grow the sport.Share Daisy's StoryAbout the GiftTitan Softball received a $40,000 matched gift from Mike Horn, professor emeritus of biological science, to connect students with a sports psychologist to help them improve their mental stamina and game day performance. Softball players are developing lifelong skills to cope with stress, anxiety and the pressures that go beyond athletics.More than 2,000 faculty and staff have supported the âIt Takes a Titanâ campaign.It takes a Titan like youCal State Fullerton is the catalyst for Titan-sized transformations, inspiring studentsâ paths, launching careers and improving lives. The university's first-ever comprehensive philanthropic campaign âIt Takes a Titan,â is an opportunity for you to be the difference in a Titanâs life.Give NowâI enjoy watching the excellent, well-coached Titan Softball team and appreciate the mutual support and family atmosphere they exhibit. When I asked how I could best help the team, Coach Kelly Ford said that a sports psychologist was of highest priority. I take great pleasure in being able to fund that need.â Mike Horn, professor emeritus of biological scienceMore StoriesStudents share, in their own words, how they were empowered by their Titan education. Thanks to you, our generous community of donors, these students discovered their passions and leadership potential in academics, arts and athletics.View More StoriesThe program cost was a barrier for me.
